column5: First time use this propane outboard and work great . When I brought it home I put the outboard upside down and there were all engine oil on the floor. But when I open the cover, inside the engine is pretty clean. Why is that, will it affect the outboard performance? Where is engine oil leak from?  Thanks in advance!

You stored the motor incorrectly. It's a 4 stroke and they need to be stored correctly or the engine oil will leak out. Either store it upright or (usually) they are required to lie on one side only. It will say in the owners manual. Most small 4 strokes I've used require being laid down on the side of the tiller handle if transporting.  Check the engine oil to make sure is within' the safe zone since you had a leak. Top up if low and you should be good to go.
pull the plug(s) and roll it aover a few times to get any oil out the could of settled in the bore

Can someone tell me where did the engine oil  came out from when I put it upside down . I will refill the engine oil.  Will the leak engine oil damage other parts or component of my outboard?  Thanks again
